metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19624 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds read was discovered in OpenCV before 4.1.1. Specifically, variable coarsest_scale is assumed to be greater than or equal to finest_scale within the calc()/ocl_calc() functions in dis_flow.cpp. However, this is not true when dealing with small images, leading to an out-of-bounds read of the heap-allocated arrays Ux and Uy.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19624` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-contrib4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-core4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-dnn4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-features2d4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-flann4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-highgui4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgcodecs4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgproc4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-ml4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-objdetect4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-photo4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-shape4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-stitching4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-superres4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-video4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-videoio4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-videostab4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-viz4.5d - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv4.5-java - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv4.5d-jni - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
opencv-data - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
python3-opencv - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opencv package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.2+dfsg-5').
